CatDescriptText: Mr. Harold Pratt, construction worker, 248 Mayflower St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that cab drivers in general take advantage of other motorists and pedestrians in traffic? As a group, would you call them courteous or discourteous?" answer reads: "The majority are courteous.  It is hard for the companies to control the actions of persons who have to hustle to make money and, as you know, a few hoodlums have to get into everything.  As a whole, they are courteous and helpful."
TitMainTitle: Man on left wearing eyeglasses writing in notebook, facing Harold Pratt wearing moustache, standing in front of chain link fence with parking lot and buildings in background
